ARABIC: لَا يُفَتَّرُ عَنْهُمْ وَهُمْ فِيهِ مُبْلِسُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: It will not be eased for them. They will be crushed there by despair.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: It will not decrease for them; dumb with despair they will stay in it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Never will their torment be lightened for them. They shall remain in utter despair.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: We had not done any injustice to them but they had wronged themselves.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And it will never be lightened upon them, and they will remain in it devastated.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: (The torment) will not be lightened for them, and they will be plunged into destruction with deep regrets, sorrows and in despair therein.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: It shall not be abated from them and they shall therein be despairing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: that is not abated for them and therein they are sore confounded.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: It is not relaxed for them, and they despair therein.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: from which there is no relief: they will remain there in utter despair.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: It shall not be abated from off them, and they will be therein despondent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: It will not be lightened for them, and they will be despondent in it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Nowise will the (Punishment) be lightened for them, and in despair will they be there overwhelmed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: (The torment) will not be lightened for them, and they will be plunged into destruction with deep regrets, sorrows and in despair therein.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: which will not be lightened for them, and therein they shall be silent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: It will never be eased for them. In it, they will be devastated.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: It will not be allowed to subside for them, and they, therein, are in despair.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [43:75] it will not be lightened for them and they will be [utterly] despondent in it, silent in despair.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (It is not relaxed for them) the torment is not removed from them nor is it interrupted, (and they despair therein) they despair in this torment about any goodness or about it being removed.
